org.jruyi.me

Interface IRouteSet


  • public interface IRouteSet
    A IRouteSet consists of and administers all the IRoutes having the same from. So IRouteSet itself is grouped by source end point.
    See Also:
    IRoute, IRoutingTable

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears all the routes in this route set.
      String from()
      Gets the ID of the source end point.
      IRoute getRoute(String to)

    • Method Detail

      • from

        String from()
        Gets the ID of the source end point.
        Returns:
        the ID of the source end point

      • getRoute

        IRoute getRoute(String to)
        Returns the route whose destination end point is the specified to .
        Parameters:
        to - the ID of the destination end point of the route need return
        Returns:
        the route [from -> to]

      • setRoute

        IRoute setRoute(String to,
              String filter)
                throws org.osgi.framework.InvalidSyntaxException
        Defines a route [from -> to] with the specified filter . And put this route into this route set.

        If a message is produced by the from of this route set and its properties matches the specified filter, then it will be routed to the specified to.

        Parameters:
        to - the ID of the destination end point
        filter - the filter string to filter the messages
        Returns:
        the route object as described
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if to is null or to.trim() is empty
        org.osgi.framework.InvalidSyntaxException - if the syntax of the filter string is not correct

      • setRoute

        IRoute setRoute(String to,
              org.osgi.framework.Filter filter)
        Defines a route [from -> to] with the specified filter . And put this route into this route set. If the route ever exists, the old filter will be overwritten.

        If a message is produced by the from of this route set and its properties matches the specified filter, then it will be routed to the specified to.

        Parameters:
        to - the ID of the destination end point
        filter - the filter to filter the messages
        Returns:
        the route object as described
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if to is null or to.trim() is empty

      • setRoute

        IRoute setRoute(String to)
        Defines a route [from -> to]. And put this route into the route set. If the route ever exists, the old filter will be removed.

        Any message produced by the from of this route set will be routed to the specified to.

        Parameters:
        to - the ID of the destination end point
        Returns:
        the route object as described
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if to is null or to.trim() is empty

      • getRoutes

        IRoute[] getRoutes()
        Gets all the routes in this route set.
        Returns:
        all the routes in this route set

      • removeRoute

        void removeRoute(String to)
        Removes the route [from -> to].
        Parameters:
        to - the ID of the destination end point

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears all the routes in this route set.

      • save

        void save()
          throws IOException
        Persists the current route set. So all the route definitions will be kept across application's life.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there's an IO error
